issue.title: All stories displayed on a single page (kitchen sink)
issue.body:
It would be nice if storybooks could run in a monorepo and generate a storybook for each package in the monorepo. It would also be nice if you had a kitchen sink that would show an example of all the components in the package in one spot rather than only seeing one at a time similar to how it's done in [React Styleguide Generator Alt](http://theogravity.github.io/react-styleguide-generator-alt). This would in effect create a kitchen sink of all the components available in the mono repo. Here's a UI mock up of what this might look like:

![react-storybook-kitchen-sink](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5115671/24922626/fdff1196-1ebc-11e7-8e25-30023519dfd6.png)

comment.body: Hey there, it's me again! I am going close this issue to help our maintainers  focus on the current development roadmap instead. If the issue mentioned is still a concern, please open a new ticket and mention this old one. Cheers and thanks for using Storybook!

issue.title: All stories displayed on a single page (kitchen sink)
issue.body:
It would be nice if storybooks could run in a monorepo and generate a storybook for each package in the monorepo. It would also be nice if you had a kitchen sink that would show an example of all the components in the package in one spot rather than only seeing one at a time similar to how it's done in [React Styleguide Generator Alt](http://theogravity.github.io/react-styleguide-generator-alt). This would in effect create a kitchen sink of all the components available in the mono repo. Here's a UI mock up of what this might look like:

![react-storybook-kitchen-sink](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5115671/24922626/fdff1196-1ebc-11e7-8e25-30023519dfd6.png)

issue.title: Tree animations perform poorly when knobs are present
issue.body:
It's easy to reproduce if you move the 'with knobs' story on the top of the 'Button' group in `examples/cra-kitchen-sink/src/stories/index.js`:
gif
I'm not really sure, should we fix it on the side of knobs, tree, or both

comment.body: Hi everyone! Seems like there hasn't been much going on in this issue lately. If there are still questions, comments, or bugs, please feel free to continue the discussion. Unfortunately, we don't have time to get to every issue. We are always open to contributions so please send us a pull request if you would like to help. Inactive issues will be closed after 60 days. Thanks!

issue.title: How to pass props to Vue.js component's story?
Add ability to use image snapshots to addon-storyshots
issue.body:
Issue: https://github.com/storybooks/storybook/issues/1781

## What I did
- Ability to generate image snapshots from stories using addon-storyshots.

## How to test
- Start fresh & bootstrap everything
- Go to _cra-kitchen-sink_
- Run `yarn run test-image-snapshots`

Is this testable with jest or storyshots?
- Not sure 

Does this need a new example in the kitchen sink apps?
- Yep done.

Does this need an update to the documentation?
- Maybe we should say something about it in the doc as it may persuade people to use storybook ? But I don't think there is a word about storyshots in the doc yet.

comment.body: @thomasbertet Hey, have you had a look at https://github.com/oblador/loki?

issue.title: Running storybook on my app's webpack or own route
issue.body:
Hello,

I am working with storybook right now, and my rails5 app already has webpacker. I want to be able to use the css in my app in the same storybook. I don't know how to hook it up so I am wondering if the storybook lived under my app instead on its own, maybe it would inherit the css.

So I guess my question is a to part. How do I get my app's css to go through to storybook dynamically like how the asset pipeline and webpack work so I don't have to import a ton of css files in my config?

Or

If that isn't possible can I run storybook on my rails server on its own route something like, example.com/styleguide?

comment.body: Hey there, it's me again! I am going close this issue to help our maintainers  focus on the current development roadmap instead. If the issue mentioned is still a concern, please open a new ticket and mention this old one. Cheers and thanks for using Storybook!

issue.title: Running storybook on my app's webpack or own route
issue.body:
Hello,

I am working with storybook right now, and my rails5 app already has webpacker. I want to be able to use the css in my app in the same storybook. I don't know how to hook it up so I am wondering if the storybook lived under my app instead on its own, maybe it would inherit the css.

So I guess my question is a to part. How do I get my app's css to go through to storybook dynamically like how the asset pipeline and webpack work so I don't have to import a ton of css files in my config?

Or

If that isn't possible can I run storybook on my rails server on its own route something like, example.com/styleguide?

issue.title: [Angular] Change template story files extension .ts
issue.body:
Issue:
Angular developers prefer TypeScript to JavaScript. It's useful that `getstorybook` cmd creates `.ts` stories files.

## What I did
- [Angular] Change template story files' extension to `.ts` .

issue.title: [Angular] Change template story files extension .ts
issue.body:
Issue:
Angular developers prefer TypeScript to JavaScript. It's useful that `getstorybook` cmd creates `.ts` stories files.

## What I did
- [Angular] Change template story files' extension to `.ts` .

issue.title: [Angular] Change template story files extension .ts
issue.body:
Issue:
Angular developers prefer TypeScript to JavaScript. It's useful that `getstorybook` cmd creates `.ts` stories files.

## What I did
- [Angular] Change template story files' extension to `.ts` .

comment.body: Make sense to me, but I'd like like to hear from people familiar with angular stuff

payload.description: Interactive development & testing environment for React, React-Native, Vue UI components

pull_request.title: Vue storyshots
pull_request.body:
Issue:  Adding storyshots support for vue

## What I did
Just wanted to check what is the complexity of adding storyshots for vue based on what is already done for angular, and looks like it's easier than angular stuff. 

Probably I need to do some cherry-pick of the main refactoring.

## How to test
For running only the vue sthoryshots:
```
node node_modules\jest\bin\jest.js vueshots
```

repo.name: storybook
repo.description: Interactive development & testing environment for React, React-Native, Vue UI components

repo.name: storybook
repo.description: Interactive development & testing environment for React, React-Native, Vue UI components

issue.title: Select knob key/value ordering
issue.body:
continued from https://github.com/storybooks/storybook/pull/1449

fixes #799

Issue:

Using knobs is currently confusing. 

Example, for complex strings and null values

```
select('My Select', {
  none: null, // renders empty item
  [`Computed key`]: 'computed', 
  'Some kind of long sentence. This is ok, mainly just looks odd as a key': 'sentence',
})
```


## What I did

Use value as value
Still uses key for the key property on each `<option>`

## How to test

```
select('My Select', {
  Empty: null,
  'First item': 'The first item selected',
  second: `The item with key 'second' is selected`
})
```



Is this testable with jest or storyshots?

Does this need a new example in the kitchen sink apps?

Does this need an update to the documentation?

If your answer is yes to any of these, please make sure to include it in your PR.

comment.body: Should we add a deprecation notice for old `select` usages?
I think we should remove the framework peer dependencies instead of adding them

issue.title: Uncaught Error: Target container is not a DOM element.
issue.body:
I am getting this error since upgrading from `3.2.18` to `3.3.3`:

```
Uncaught Error: Target container is not a DOM element.
    at invariant (invariant.js:42)
    at renderSubtreeIntoContainer (react-dom.development.js:15180)
    at Object.render (react-dom.development.js:15290)
    at exports.default (routes.js:39)
    at App.init (app.js:119)
    at exports.default (index.js:41)
    at Object.<anonymous> (index.js:16)
    at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap 77c5cb83d0653d7a60e4:678)
    at fn (bootstrap 77c5cb83d0653d7a60e4:88)
    at Object.defineProperty.value (fuse.js:996)
```

And the page is just showing the following text:

```
/static/media/index.html.3cbc7277.ejs
```

commits.message: Extract common config-loading logic to a separate module

issue.title: Angular storyshots
issue.body:
Issue: Adding storyshots support for angular

## What I did
1. I have a BDay - this is my cake =) 🍰 
2. I've refactored storyshots to make it easier to integrate new frameworks
3. There are these PRs (#2517, #2413) that should happen before
4. I have concerns about adding every new framework to peer dep... Should people install all these angular/polymer/~~knockout~~/aurelia packages? 🤕 
5. There is a lot of copy-past 
6. I don't know how to make props to be visible in snapshots =(
7. One storyshot is failing. We need to refactor more things to be able to run framework-specific preparations with beforeEach. 

## How to test
For running only the angular sthoryshots:
```
node node_modules\jest\bin\jest.js angularshots
```
